title: JSW Steel unit will increase stake in M Res NSW to 83.3%
description: JSW Steel's market-linked contract with Illawarra Metallurgical Coal allows it to purchase hard coking coal in proportion to its economic interest in the company. The steel maker had already acquired a 66.67% economic interest in M Res NSW last year. With its additional stake buy in the company, it will hold an 83.33% stake in the company.

title: India to spend $570 million to help steel companies decarbonise
description: Steel demand in India is growing due to a wave of infrastructure projects and rising demand for new homes. Many small steel plants are being built as they are easier to set up, but are highly polluting.

title: Govt plans Rs 5,000 cr scheme to promote decarbonisation in steel industry: Steel secy
description: The Indian government is developing a Rs 5,000 crore scheme to encourage the adoption of clean steel-making technologies and reduce carbon emissions. This National Mission for Sustainable Steel aims to support all steel manufacturers, with a focus on secondary players, by providing incentives based on emission reduction.

title: US tariffs won't have direct impact on India's steel industry, official says
description: India’s steel secretary Sandeep Poundrik said U.S. tariffs will have little impact on Indian steel, but the EU’s carbon border adjustment mechanism (CBAM) poses a significant risk as two-thirds of exports go to Europe. High-emission blast furnace production raises concerns, while India also faces pressure from cheap Chinese imports. A safeguard duty of 11–12% on some products is under consideration.

title: Jindal Steel International makes non-binding offer for thyssenkrupp’s steel operations
description: Jindal Steel International, owned by Naveen Jindal, has made a non-binding offer to acquire thyssenkrupp Steel Europe, committing over 2 billion euros to green steel production. The plan aims to transform thyssenkrupp into Europe's largest low-emission steelmaker, securing German steel production and creating new business opportunities.

title: Thyssenkrupp receives non-binding bid for steel unit from Jindal Steel
description: Thyssenkrupp has acknowledged receiving a non-binding offer from India's Jinal Steel for its steel division. The company's Executive Board will thoroughly assess the bid, placing particular emphasis on economic viability, the ongoing green transformation initiatives, and the preservation of jobs at its steel production facilities. Further details regarding the offer remain undisclosed.

title: SAIL draws plans for green push alongside diversification plans
description: SAIL is set to integrate green technologies and customer-centric solutions in its upcoming projects, aiming for sustainable steel production. The company plans to expand its crude steel capacity to around 35 million tonnes by 2031, aligning with the National Steel Policy 2017. SAIL is also exploring hydrogen-based steelmaking and carbon capture technologies to reduce its carbon footprint.

title: Govt raids Jindal Saw, Maharashtra Seamless in antitrust case, sources say
description: India’s antitrust watchdog carried out surprise raids at Jindal SAW and Maharashtra Seamless offices near New Delhi over alleged bid rigging in ONGC tenders, sources said. The searches, linked to a 2023 complaint by ONGC, have concluded. CCI and the companies did not comment. Investigations typically involve document collection and questioning, and can take months.

title: Industry looking to develop high-grade steel to cut auto sector's import dependence: Kumaraswamy
description: Union Minister H D Kumaraswamy announced that India's steel industry aims to develop specialized high-grade steel for automotive components, reducing import dependence. Companies under the PLI auto scheme have invested Rs 29,576 crore, creating jobs and boosting manufacturing. The steel ministry pledges support to the auto sector, fostering 'Make In India' and sustainable mobility solutions.

title: Engaged with Govt on reducing input cost for making steel, says Indian Steel Association Secy General
description: The Indian Steel Association (ISA) is engaging with the government to lower steel production costs by making iron ore more affordable, aiming to boost the industry's competitiveness. Steel demand in India is projected to grow steadily at 7-8% annually. The government is actively supporting the steel sector through policy engagement and measures like anti-dumping actions.

title: 12% safeguard duty on steel products sufficient, will seek more if import create challenges: Naveen Jindal
description: Naveen Jindal states that the proposed 12 percent safeguard duty on specific steel imports is adequate. He mentions the industry might seek government intervention if future import challenges arise. Jindal highlights the impact of US tariffs on global steel prices. He anticipates domestic steel demand to grow in double digits in fiscal year 2026.

title: Government to greenlight incentives to drive green steel output
description: The Indian government is preparing a national mission with a proposed outlay of ₹5,000 crore to promote sustainable steel production, targeting both primary and secondary producers. This initiative aims to decarbonize the steel sector through financial support like concessional loans and risk guarantees.

title: GST reforms will mitigate US tariff impact on Indian economy, says secondary steel industry body
description: Yogesh Mandhani, president of AIIFA, stated that GST reforms have lessened the impact of US tariffs on India's economy and advocated for mining policy changes to lower steel production costs by increasing iron ore availability. He also urged for uniform power tariffs across the nation to enhance the competitiveness and capacity utilization of secondary steel producers, currently operating at 68-70%.

title: Pradhin Ltd plans to foray into steel, raw material exports, mulls bonus issue
description: Pradhin Ltd is considering a strategic expansion into the global steel and raw materials trading and export market, aiming to capitalize on shifting global trade dynamics. The company's board will meet on September 7 to discuss the expansion and a potential bonus issue of up to 10:1 to reward shareholders and improve stock liquidity.

title: Mukand Sumi Special Steel to invest Rs 2,300 cr in greenfield project in Karnataka
description: Mukand Sumi Special Steel will invest Rupees 2,345 crore for a new project in Kanakpura, Karnataka. This venture aims to boost the company's production to 7,00,000 tonnes annually. The facility will manufacture high-grade steel for various sectors like automotive and railways. The company will focus on sustainable practices. It will use renewable energy and a zero-discharge model.

title: Indian steelmakers urge government for minimum import price amid global slump
description: Indian steelmakers are requesting a minimum import price from the government as current safeguard duties prove insufficient amidst falling global prices. Industry executives report that hot rolled coils are trading significantly lower than expected, impacting profit margins. Analysts suggest a balanced approach, considering consumer prices and anticipating stable raw material costs and subdued global demand.

title: Tailored emission targets proposed for steel players
description: India is set to introduce emission reduction targets for its major steel manufacturers. These goals align with the National Steel Policy 2017. Companies failing to meet targets will face penalties. However, they can offset these with carbon credits. Larger players will have stricter goals. Smaller producers will have moderate targets.

title: Tata Steel announces Rs 303.13 crore bonus for employees for FY'25
description: Tata Steel announced a Rs 303.13 crore bonus payout for its employees for the 2024-25 financial year, following an agreement with the Tata Workers' Union. For Jamshedpur divisions, Rs 152.44 crore will be distributed among 11,446 employees. The minimum and maximum bonus amounts are set at Rs 39,004 and Rs 3,92,213, respectively.

title: US tariff will not have much impact on domestic steel sector: Tata Steel CEO T V Narendran
description: Tata Steel CEO T V Narendran stated that the US tariff of 50% is unlikely to significantly affect the domestic steel sector, though its European operations might experience some impact due to existing tariffs. He acknowledged challenges but highlighted positive domestic growth and demand. The government is devising strategies, including GST reforms, to mitigate the tariff's effects.

title: India steelmakers seek near-sevenfold rise in met coke import quota amid supply crunch
description: Indian steel producers are urging the government to significantly increase import quotas for low-ash metallurgical coke, citing a critical supply shortage due to rapid capacity expansion. They are requesting a near sevenfold increase, with the largest share of additional shipments sought from Indonesia, Japan, and Poland.

title: Inter-ministerial meeting discusses ways to boost steel production, exports
description: A high-level inter-ministerial meeting convened in New Delhi to strategize on enhancing India's iron ore and steel sectors. Discussions centered on increasing production and exports, streamlining costs, and maximizing capacity utilization. The collaborative effort aims to foster a competitive, resilient, and sustainable ecosystem for the iron and steel industry through government-industry coordination.

title: SAIL supplies 8,000 tonnes of critical grade steel to Indian Navy's advanced frontline frigates
description: SAIL provided about 8,000 tonnes of steel for INS Udaygiri and INS Himgiri. Rajnath Singh launched these advanced frigates. The ships are part of Project 17A. SAIL supplied steel from Bokaro, Bhilai, and Rourkela plants. This supports 'Atmanirbhar Bharat'. SAIL also supplied steel for INS Vikrant and other vessels. This reduces India's reliance on imported steel for defense.

title: BMW Industries invests Rs 803 cr to boost high-end steel product offerings for auto, infra sectors, says MD Bansal
description: BMW Industries is investing Rs 803 crore to establish a 0.5 million tonne cold rolling unit in Jharkhand, supported by the government's PLI Scheme for Speciality Steel. This expansion will boost the company's manufacturing capacity to 2.5 MnT and enable the production of colour-coated and advanced alloy products for various industries.

title: JSW Steel and South Korea's POSCO team up for 6MTPA steel plant in India
description: JSW Steel and South Korea's POSCO Group plan a major steel plant in India. The plant will produce six million tonnes annually. Both companies signed an agreement for this joint venture. This partnership builds on an earlier understanding from October 2024. The goal is to create a globally competitive manufacturing hub. This hub will serve both Indian and international markets.

title: Safeguard import duties on steel could cripple auto, engineering, and construction sectors: GTRI
description: A three-year safeguard duty on steel imports, initiated by DGTR due to increased imports and declining domestic profits, faces strong opposition. GTRI's report suggests this duty could negatively impact auto, engineering, and construction sectors by raising input costs. Stakeholders argue that the duty will harm export competitiveness and create sourcing challenges, despite domestic steelmakers' profitability.

title: DGTR recommends 3-year safeguard duty on steel imports to protect local industry
description: The Directorate General of Trade Remedies (DGTR) has suggested imposing a safeguard duty on specific flat steel product imports for three years, aiming to shield domestic manufacturers from a surge in inbound shipments. The recommended duty starts at 12% in the first year, decreasing to 11% by the third year.

title: Commerce ministry recommends safeguard duty on imports of certain steel items for 3 years
description: The DGTR has recommended a safeguard duty on certain flat steel imports for three years to protect domestic manufacturers from a surge in inbound shipments. This decision follows a probe initiated by the Indian Steel Association, citing a significant increase in imports causing injury to the domestic industry.

title: Per capita steel consumption in India at 100 kg, says steel secretary
description: India's steel sector is experiencing significant growth, with production rising by over 12% despite global declines. The nation's per capita steel consumption has reached 100 kg, a key milestone as the National Steel Policy 2017 aims for 160 kg by 2030-31.

title: Jindal Steel’s net profit up 12% to Rs 1,496 crore in June quarter
description: Jindal Steel's net profit increased by nearly 12% to Rs 1,496 crore in the June quarter, driven by improved profitability despite a 9% drop in gross revenue to Rs 14,336 crore. The company's adjusted EBITDA per tonne of steel rose to Rs 15,680, while net debt increased to Rs 14,400 crore.

title: Ministry of Steel grants BIS exemption to 202 foreign steel manufacturers
description: The Ministry of Steel has exempted 202 BIS licenses from mandatory SIMS compliance to simplify steel imports, especially for Integrated Steel Plants. Covering manufacturers from 16 countries, including Japan and South Korea, this move eases procedural hurdles, ensures smoother supply, and supports ease of doing business. The exemption is temporary and applies only to listed licenses.

title: Supreme Court reserves verdict on JSW Steel's Rs 19,700 crore resolution plan for Bhushan Power
description: The Supreme Court has reserved its verdict on JSW Steel's resolution plan for Bhushan Power and Steel. Key issues include the allocation of earnings generated during the resolution period and JSW's compliance with the plan. Former promoters challenged JSW's actions, while the creditors seek additional funds. The Solicitor General criticized the former promoters, alleging significant financial misconduct.

title: Indian alloy steel producers file anti-dumping plea against Chinese steel, executive says
description: Indian alloy steel producers have lodged an anti-dumping petition with the trade ministry against inexpensive alloy steel imports from China. The Alloy Steel Producers Association of India (ASPA) reports a surge in Chinese wire rod imports at very low prices, significantly impacting local manufacturers. The petition, filed on July 31, seeks relief for producers like JSW Steel and Jindal Steel.

title: Global, domestic steel companies to conduct joint studies on carbon capture and utilisation
description: A consortium of steel giants, including ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel India and JSW Steel, is conducting pre-feasibility studies for Carbon Capture, Utilisation and Storage (CCUS) hubs across Asia. The study aims to identify technical and commercial pathways for large-scale CCUS projects, exploring CO2 repurposing and transportation to storage sites.

title: Stainless steel industry seeks anti-dumping duties on cheap imports to protect local players
description: The Indian stainless steel industry is seeking anti-dumping duties on cheap imports, primarily from China, Vietnam, and Indonesia, which are impacting domestic players. The ISSDA has filed a petition with the DGTR, requesting an investigation into the dumping of stainless steel items. Rising imports, reaching 1.73 million tonnes in FY25, necessitate protecting homegrown companies amid global trade uncertainties.

title: Bhushan Power and Steel lenders seek Rs 6,155 cr interest from JSW over resolution delay
description: Lenders of Bhushan Power and Steel (BPSL) told the top Court on that they are entitled to over Rs 6,155 crore in interest from JSW Steel due to delays in implementing the Rs 19,700 crore resolution plan for the debt-laden company, which JSW acquired in 2021.

title: Steel Exchange India plans to develop cargo terminal, multi-modal logistics park in Vizag
description: Steel Exchange India has partnered with Vizag Profiles Logistics and Hind Terminals to explore developing a cargo terminal and multi-modal logistics park in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh. This collaboration aims to enhance logistics efficiency and reduce transit times in the region. The move signifies Steel Exchange India's expansion into infrastructure and logistics beyond steel manufacturing.

title: No direct impact on JSW biz, but sentiment in India will be hit: Parth Jindal on Trump's tariff
description: Parth Jindal of JSW Group says Trump's tariffs won't directly impact their business. He acknowledges potential negative sentiment in India. Jindal highlights the government's efforts to support affected industries like gems, jewellery and textiles. He emphasizes India's focus on its own interests. Jindal reflects on the strong India-US relationship, expressing confusion over the recent tariff hike.

title: JSW Steel seeks bigger share of met coke quotas to meet shortfall, sources say
description: JSW Steel is requesting the Indian government to increase its import quota for low-ash metallurgical coke due to operational difficulties at its Karnataka and Chhattisgarh plants. The current quota, part of a broader import curb, is hindering operations, and logistical costs prevent sufficient internal supply adjustments.

title: Stricter rules likely to curb substandard steel imports
description: India is planning to tighten norms for steel imports under the advance authorisation scheme to curb the inflow of substandard, non-BIS compliant steel. The government is considering lowering the Export Obligation Period to six months and withdrawing QCO exemptions for domestic importers. These measures aim to prevent the diversion of duty-free steel into the domestic market, protecting local manufacturers.

title: Jindal Stainless MD calls for anti-dumping duty amid global uncertainties
description: Abhyuday Jindal emphasizes the need for anti-dumping duties on stainless steel. He cites steep US tariffs and global trade uncertainties. Jindal Stainless reported a rise in its first quarter profit and revenue. The Indian Stainless Steel Development Association seeks anti-dumping duty. Imports hurt the domestic industry, while exports face uncertainty due to US tariffs.

title: Tata Steel rolls out first batch of galvanised coils from newly commissioned line at Kalinganagar
description: Tata Steel has started a new galvanised coil production line at Kalinganagar, Odisha. The first batch of coils is now out. This new line has advanced technology for high-quality steel. It will produce steel for cars and appliances. The expansion project cost Rupees 27,000 crore. This expansion increases the plant's total production capacity.

title: Mangalam Worldwide profit jumps 68%, revenue by 21% in June quarter
description: Mangalam Worldwide reported a significant surge in profit after tax, exceeding 68% to reach Rs 10.13 crore for the April-June quarter of 2025-26. The company's total income also experienced substantial growth, rising by over 21% to Rs 279.41 crore, driven by improved efficiencies and increased demand for stainless steel across key markets. Adjusted EBITDA increased by 53.

title: SAIL supplies special grade steel for INS Ajay, INS Nistar
description: Steel Authority of India Ltd (SAIL) reinforces its commitment to defence indigenisation by supplying critical-grade steel for INS Ajay and INS Nistar. SAIL provided special DMR grade steel plates for INS Ajay, the final vessel in the ASW-SWC series, ensuring structural integrity.

title: JSW Steel, Japan's JFE to invest $669 million to boost cold rolled grain-oriented electrical steel output
description: JSW Steel and Japan's JFE Steel will invest 58.45 billion rupees ($669 million) to expand production capacity of cold rolled grain-oriented electrical steel across two Indian plants to 350,000 tons per annum, JSW Steel said on Monday.

title: Nepal, China steel may face duty evasion probe
description: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence may investigate steel imports from Nepal and China. This action aims to shield the Indian steel industry from substandard products. Nepal has become a major steel exporter to India. Concerns arise about Chinese steel being routed through Nepal. Some Chinese companies are allegedly falsifying quality compliance documents.

title: Land acquisition for mega steel plant to begin soon in Odisha's Keonjhar: CM Majhi
description: Odisha Chief Minister Mohan Charan Majhi announced that land acquisition for a Rs 40,000 crore mega steel plant in Keonjhar will begin soon, as the required funds have been deposited. The project, a JSW-POSCO joint venture with 5 MTPA capacity, is expected to boost the local economy and employment. Majhi also reviewed district projects and flagged off public service vehicles.

title: Over 1,000 RINL employees opt for VRS: MoS Steel Bhupathiraju Srinivasa Varma
description: Over 1,000 employees of the disinvestment-bound steelmaker RINL have applied for a voluntary retirement scheme (VRS). The VRS benefits align with Department of Public Enterprises guidelines. This development occurs amidst the government's ongoing efforts to disinvest RINL, a decision that has faced considerable opposition, despite the company's financial struggles and liabilities.

title: Steel industry has few players as most struggle to survive: Tata Steel MD TV Narendran
description: "If steel demand in India has to grow to 250-300 million tonne, then there is a lot of investment that is required," Narendran told ET in an interview. "It is not that the industry is financially fantastic; you have fewer players because more and more people are struggling to survive in this industry," he said.

title: Cost takeout to continue in coming quarters to maintain profitability: Tata Steel CFO
description: Tata Steel's net profit more than doubled in the June quarter, driven by increased steel realisations and strategic cost takeouts. The company aims to maintain profitability through continued cost reduction measures across geographies in the coming quarters. While Indian revenue per tonne is expected to decrease in Q2, overall volumes are projected to rise.

title: SAIL looks to invest Rs 7,500 cr as capex in FY26, reports all-time high Q1 sales
description: SAIL plans a Rs 7,500 crore capex for FY25, a 25% increase, to boost capacity across its plants, aiming for 35 MnT by 2030. Expansion is underway at IISCO and Durgapur Steel Plants. The company reported a strong Q1 with increased profit and sales, while anticipating robust domestic demand despite global overcapacity and import pressures.

title: Tata Steel to explore new markets as tariffs hit US shipments
description: Tata Steel plans to tap markets in the Middle East and Latin America to offset the impact of U.S. tariffs. CEO T.V. Narendran said U.S.-bound exports from the Netherlands face 50% duty, while U.K. exports benefit from a separate deal. Though India's exports to the U.S. are limited, the company aims to reduce dependency and build stable demand elsewhere.

title: SC recalls order cancelling JSW’s Rs 19,300 cr Bhushan Power resolution plan; Fresh hearing on Aug 7
description: The Supreme Court has recalled its previous order that cancelled JSW Steel's resolution plan for Bhushan Power and Steel Ltd, deeming it a suitable case for review. The court acknowledged that the prior judgment might not have adequately considered established legal precedents. A comprehensive hearing is scheduled for next Thursday to re-examine all legal and factual aspects of the case.

title: Green steel demand to reach 4.49 MnT in 2030 driven by construction, infra sectors: EY-Parthenon
description: India's green steel demand is set for substantial growth. A new report forecasts demand to hit 4.49 MnT by 2030. Construction, infrastructure, and automobiles will drive this surge. Demand could reach 73.44 MnT by FY40. Green hydrogen technology is crucial for meeting this demand. The initial price premium for green steel will decrease over time.

title: CAG pulls up SAIL for over-consumption of imported coal
description: A CAG report revealed that SAIL incurred an extra ₹2,539.68 crore due to excessive imported coal consumption from 2016 to 2023. The report also highlighted SAIL's failure to set inventory cost benchmarks, leading to inefficient raw material management and a revenue loss of ₹1,231.52 crore. Furthermore, non-moving inventory increased, and dispatch delays contributed to higher inventory carrying costs.

title: CAG points to inventory handling lapses at SAIL
description: The Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG) has revealed significant discrepancies in Steel Authority of India Limited's (SAIL) inventory management from 2016 to 2023, leading to financial losses. Faulty price fixation for blast furnace slag resulted in a revenue loss of ₹441.40 crore. Inadequate inventory control of raw materials further caused production shortfalls and a potential revenue loss of ₹1,231.52 crore.

title: SC lists review petitions of JSW Steel and BPSL lenders in open court on July 31
description: The Supreme Court will review its May 2 judgment regarding Bhushan Power and Steel (BPSL) liquidation, hearing petitions from JSW Steel and lenders on July 31. JSW and lenders argue that JSW's Rs 19,350-crore resolution plan, implemented in 2021, revitalized BPSL, increasing its operational capacity and sales, and contributing significantly to the exchequer.

title: India's April-June finished steel imports fall nearly 30% as China, Japan shipments slow
description: India's finished steel imports fell 28.8% in April–June due to a sharp drop in shipments from China (down 45.8%) and Japan (down 65.2%). A 12% safeguard duty curbed cheap imports. South Korea remained the top exporter. Steel exports dipped 5.1%, though shipments to Belgium rose. Domestic crude steel output rose 11.2%, while consumption increased 7.9%.

title: ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel India gets tech licence for steel slag aggegates
description: ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel India has secured a license for steel slag road technology, partnering with CSIR-CRRI. This technology allows the company to process steel slag aggregates for road construction, offering a cost-effective and durable alternative to traditional materials. Steel slag roads are expected to last longer and withstand diverse climates, promoting sustainable use of steel by-products.

title: Govt working on modalities to mandate green steel public procurement: Official
description: The government is exploring mandating public procurement of green steel to facilitate a transition from traditional carbon steel. While the specifics are still being developed, the initiative aims to promote steel production with significantly reduced carbon emissions. The Ministry of Steel is also preparing a Green Steel Mission with a budget of Rs 15,000 crore.

title: Jindal Steel and Power renamed as Jindal Steel
description: Jindal Steel and Power Limited is now officially Jindal Steel Limited, effective July 22, 2025, following government approval. This name change, as per a company filing, signifies a sharper focus on its core steel business and strategic direction. The company will continue operating as a public limited entity.

title: Watch out for cheap steel, JSW tells India amid rising China flow
description: JSW Steel's Jayant Acharya cautions India about potential steel dumping, particularly from China, due to global oversupply concerns exacerbated by US tariffs. Despite a safeguard duty, increased Chinese steel imports pose a risk. JSW Steel is experiencing significant profit growth and plans to expand its steelmaking capacity, primarily within India, driven by strong domestic demand.

title: CJI to Form Bench on JSW, lenders’ plea against Bhushan Power liquidation
description: Chief Justice of India BR Gavai said he will soon constitute a bench to hear review petitions filed by JSW Steel and lenders of Bhushan Power and Steel (BPSL) challenging the Supreme Court’s May 2 order directing BPSL’s liquidation.

title: SAIL powers Zojila tunnel as single-largest steel supplier at over 31,000 tonnes
description: Steel Authority of India Limited (SAIL) has emerged as the largest steel supplier for the Zojila Tunnel project in Jammu and Kashmir, contributing over 31,000 tonnes of steel. This ambitious project, once completed in 2027, will establish all-weather connectivity between Srinagar and Leh, solidifying SAIL's role in India's infrastructure development.

title: JSW Steel to pour most of its Rs 20,000 crore capex into Dolvi plant
description: JSW Steel will allocate ₹20,000 crore for capital expenditure this fiscal year. A significant portion will fund the Dolvi plant expansion, increasing capacity to 15 million tonnes by September 2027. Remaining funds will complete projects at Bhushan Power and other ventures. The company aims for 50 million tonnes of annual steel production by 2030-31, focusing on brownfield expansion.

title: JSW Steel’s PAT more than doubles in Jun quarter on higher volumes, lower costs
description: JSW Steel witnessed a significant surge in net profit during the June quarter. The company's profit more than doubled, reaching Rs 2,209 crore. This boost was fueled by increased sales volume in India and reduced costs. Steel sales volume rose by 9% year-on-year, reaching 6.69 million tonnes. The company's EBITDA also saw a substantial increase of 37% year-on-year.

title: AM/NS India expanding capacity for downstream products by more than 51% by this year-end: Dilip Oommen
description: AM/NS India is significantly boosting its downstream product capacity by over 51% to five million tonnes by year-end, aiming to meet rising demand from the auto and appliance sectors. This expansion, part of an ₹8,500 crore investment, includes commissioning a galvanizing line capable of producing high-strength steel, reducing imports.

title: ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel India commissions new line at Hazira plant to produce high-strength steel
description: ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel India has commissioned a new production line at its Hazira plant in Gujarat, enabling the production of high-strength steel for the automotive sector. This continuous galvanising line, part of a larger Rs 60,000 crore investment, will produce Advanced High-Strength Steel up to 1180 MPa.

title: Tata Group Chairman performs ground breaking of 1.25 bn pound green steel project in UK
description: Tata Group Chairman N Chandrasekaran initiated a green steel project in Port Talbot. The project aims to cut carbon emissions significantly. This transformation involves switching to an electric arc furnace. The UK government supports this initiative with a substantial investment. The project is expected to secure thousands of jobs.

title: Wheels India infuses €50,000 into newly formed European subsidiary
description: Wheels India Limited is expanding its reach. The company invests in WIL Europe GmbH. The investment is 50,000 euros. WIL Europe GmbH is a wholly owned subsidiary. It will handle automotive and supply chain activities. Wheels India earmarked Rs 250 crore for capital expenditure. The company reported a net profit of Rs 105.9 crore for the last financial year.

title: Tata Steel executes first fully digital import transaction using e-Bill of Lading
description: Tata Steel has completed its first paperless import transaction using an Electronic Bill of Lading for a coal shipment from Australia to India. This digitized process, facilitated by ICE Digital Trade and involving multiple banks, aims to enhance supply chain efficiency and sustainability. The initiative aligns with Tata Steel's goal of achieving Net Zero emissions by 2045 through eco-friendly practices.

title: Steel quality rules deferred by a month
description: "The mandatory adherence requirement of input steel for imports of steel products with bill of lading having shipped on board date on or before July 15 shall be exempted," the steel ministry said in a clarification. The move brings relief to micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) that had been given little time to comply.

title: India plans tariffs to counter US steel, aluminium duties
description: India has proposed retaliatory tariffs against the US under WTO norms in response to American tariffs on steel and aluminium, impacting $7.6 billion of Indian exports. The proposed tariffs aim to collect an equivalent amount of duty from US products. This development occurs as India and the US negotiate a trade agreement, with the first phase expected by September-October.

title: Tata Steel to begin construction work of UK's low-carbon project this month
description: Tata Steel is set to commence its low-carbon steel project in the UK this month. The project, valued at 1.5 billion pounds, includes 500 million pounds in UK government funding. Operations at the Port Talbot site are expected to begin by 2027. This transition involves moving to electric arc furnace-based steelmaking. Production in India, Netherlands, and Thailand remained relatively stable.

title: Centre may relax quality control compliance window for steel intermediates
description: The Steel Ministry is likely to grant a 15-20 day grace period before enforcing quality control orders on intermediate steel materials, addressing concerns raised by stakeholders about compliance timelines. This decision follows worries about substandard imports, particularly those entering from Vietnam but originating from China, exploiting Free Trade Agreements. A technical committee has been formed to investigate these issues.

title: Tata Steel ties up with InQuik to bring Modular Bridge Technology to India for faster bridge construction
description: Tata Steel has signed an agreement with Australia’s InQuik Group to bring modular bridge technology to India. The plan is to use InQuik’s prefabricated steel formwork, which speeds up bridge building and keeps costs low. The move will help link remote regions and strengthen transport links. Tata Steel sees this as part of its push to move beyond steel production and deliver smart construction solutions that match India’s fast-changing needs. Both firms see big potential in this collaboration.

title: Jindal (India) gets nod for Rs 3,600-cr steel project in Odisha
description: Jindal (India) Limited secures approval for a Rs 3,600 crore steel plant in Odisha. The company plans a Rs 15,000 crore investment in three phases by 2030. The new facility will manufacture special coated steel products. It will feature advanced coating lines with a 9.6 lakh MT annual capacity, commissioned by 2027.

title: Tata Steel gets Rs 1,902 crore demand notice over alleged mineral dispatch shortfall
description: Tata Steel faces a demand of Rs 1,902.72 crore from Odisha's mining authorities due to an alleged shortfall in mineral dispatch from its Sukinda Chromite Block. The demand, based on a revised assessment, pertains to the period from July 2023 to July 2024. Tata Steel contests the claim, asserting it lacks justification and plans to pursue legal remedies.

title: After NMDC and MECON, steel maker SAIL opens office in Dubai to boost global presence
description: Steel Authority of India Limited has opened a representative office in Dubai. The aim is to boost steel exports and strengthen trade ties. The office will serve as a hub for the Middle East and North Africa region. Union Minister H D Kumaraswamy inaugurated the office. SAIL sources limestone from Stevin Rock LLC.

title: Stainless steel industry calls for safeguard measures to protect local players
description: Abhyuday Jindal, MD of Jindal Stainless, urges for protectionist measures to curb cheap steel imports, emphasizing India's sufficient production capacity. He highlights that nations globally are adopting protective measures and appreciates the government's efforts to safeguard the domestic steel industry. Jindal also advocates for a separate National Stainless Steel policy to promote the sector's interests.

title: Tata Steel confident to complete green steel transition in Europe as planned: Chairman N Chandrasekaran
description: Tata Steel is on track to transition to green steel manufacturing in the UK and Netherlands within the next few years. The UK operations are moving towards electric arc furnace-based steelmaking by fiscal 2028, supported by government funding. In the Netherlands, discussions are ongoing for financial support, alongside a cost transformation program.

title: Niti Aayog raises concern on China's monopoly over critical minerals supply
description: Niti Aayog member Arvind Virmani warned that 80–90% of critical mineral supply is controlled by one country, creating global concerns over monopolies. Speaking at the India Mining Summit 2025, he stressed diversifying supply chains, boosting India’s exploration and recycling through NCMM, and collaborating with nations like Peru and African countries. He urged global efforts to build competitive technologies.

title: India's first large pvt gold mine in Andhra Pradesh to soon begin full-scale production: DGML MD
description: Deccan Gold Mines Ltd announced that India's first large private gold mine in Andhra Pradesh is poised to commence full-scale production soon. This development is significant as India heavily relies on gold imports. The Jonnagiri gold project anticipates producing 750 kilograms of gold annually, potentially increasing India's total gold production by nearly one tonne.

title: World is crazy for copper: Anil Agarwal flags soaring demand, cites AI and defence needs
description: Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal highlights the surging global demand for copper, fueled by clean energy, AI data centers, and increased military spending. He cautions that demand will soon exceed supply, emphasizing India's potential to boost domestic production and reduce reliance on imports. A proposed $53 billion mining merger underscores the industry's anticipation of rising copper needs.

title: NCLT defers final hearing on Vedanta demerger to Oct 8
description: The NCLT has postponed Vedanta's demerger hearing to October 8, 2025, following objections from the Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas regarding insufficient disclosures about the RJ block. The ministry seeks clarifications on the concealment of facts, particularly concerning exploration blocks and associated loans. Vedanta's counsel asserts compliance, highlighting NCLAT's clearance of the power and metal business restructuring.

title: Vedanta to keep coal as base energy source amid clean energy push
description: Vedanta Ltd will continue to rely on coal as its primary energy source for mining operations, while aiming to increase the share of renewable sources in its energy mix. The company plans to reduce its dependence on coal-based power to around 50-60% over the next three to four years.

title: Coal India emerges preferred bidder for Ontillu-Chandragiri rare earth block
description: Coal India Limited has been designated as the preferred bidder for the Ontillu-Chandragiri Rare Earth Element Exploration Block. Awarded by the Ministry of Mines, the block covers 209.62 square kilometres and will be explored under a license granted according to the Mines and Minerals Act. This strategic move aligns with India's efforts to secure critical minerals.

title: Vedanta Resources CEO outlines demerger roadmap and likely timing, reveals immediate priority
description: Vedanta Resources is moving forward with its corporate restructuring, anticipating the demerger of its Indian arm to be finalised within this financial year. CEO Deshnee Naidoo is optimistic after a hurdle was cleared with the Talwandi Sabo Power Ltd settlement.

title: Vedanta to retain coal as base energy source, top executive says
description: Vedanta Limited will continue using coal as its main energy source for mining. The company aims to increase renewable energy use. It plans to cut coal dependence to 50-60% in three to four years. Vedanta is exploring renewable options like solar and wind. Its Zambian unit has restored copper production.

title: Midcap Tega Industries $1.5 bn Molycop buy gives investors exposure to green economy's industrial backbone
description: Tega Industries, a Kolkata-based company, acquired Molycop in a significant deal. This buyout marks a major move by an Indian enterprise. Led by Mehul Mohanka, Tega partnered with Apollo Global Management for the acquisition. The deal aims to create a comprehensive offering for the mining industry. The combined entity will leverage technology to optimize mining operations.

title: Study finds high-end aluminium alloy project in AP commercially unviable: Nalco report
description: A joint venture between Nalco and MIDHANI to establish a high-end aluminium alloy plant in Andhra Pradesh has been deemed commercially unviable due to insufficient demand and low aluminium consumption in key sectors. The project, aimed at reducing import dependency and promoting 'Make in India', faces potential closure after a market survey revealed its lack of financial viability.

title: Vedanta seeks CCI nod to acquire debt-laden Jaiprakash Associates
description: Vedanta has sought the CCI's approval to acquire Jaiprakash Associates (JAL) through the corporate insolvency resolution process. Vedanta's bid of Rs 12,505 crore surpassed Adani Group's offer. The proposed transaction aims to resolve JAL's insolvency, with Vedanta planning upfront and annual payments. However, CreditSights views the acquisition as credit negative for Vedanta.

title: SC upholds validity of Coal India's 2006 interim coal policy, sets aside Calcutta HC verdict
description: The Supreme Court has validated Coal India Limited's 2006 interim coal policy, which imposed a 20% price increase on coal supplied to non-core sector industries. Overturning a Calcutta High Court decision, the apex court affirmed Coal India's authority to regulate prices and dismissed claims that the policy violated constitutional rights. The court also rejected requests for refunds from private firms.

title: Government to roll out tranche II of coal gasification VGF soon
description: The coal ministry is set to launch a second round of viability gap funding (VGF) of approximately Rs 2400 crore for coal gasification projects. They are also collaborating with the Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas (MoPNG) to facilitate the sale of byproducts like methanol and green hydrogen.

title: Vedanta settles dispute with Chinese firm SEPCO Electric
description: Vedanta has settled its long-standing dispute with Chinese firm Sepco Electric, clearing the way for its revenue-stream demerger, now expected by September-end. The settlement resolves all claims and withdraws pending arbitration over the Talwandi Sabo 3x660 MW thermal project.

title: Coal India to raise workers’ ex gratia in mine accidents to Rs 25 lakh from Sept 17: Minister
description: Union Coal Minister, G Kishan Reddy, announced that Coal India Ltd. will increase ex gratia payments for mine accident victims to ₹25 lakh from ₹15 lakh, effective September 17th. In a first, CIL will introduce uniforms for all employees to promote unity and discipline. Additionally, employees will receive ₹1 crore in accidental insurance, with contractual workers getting ₹40 lakh.

title: Critical Mineral Mission to boost exploration efforts: G Kishan Reddy
description: Union Minister G Kishan Reddy announced the National Critical Minerals Mission, backed by Rs 32,000 crore, to boost critical mineral exploration and mining. The mission aims for self-reliance, with the Geological Survey of India undertaking 1,200 exploration projects. India has identified 30 critical minerals essential for clean energy and national security, streamlining their auctioning and supply.

title: Readying fiscal incentives for domestic rare-earth magnet production: H D Kumaraswamy
description: India is preparing fiscal incentives to boost domestic production of rare-earth magnets, crucial for electric vehicle motors, as announced by Union Minister H D Kumaraswamy. A scheme targeting global value chain participation is being developed, offering support for capital and operational expenditures. The Production Linked Incentive Scheme has already spurred significant investment and job creation in the automotive sector.

title: India's coking coal imports set to rise as steel capacity targets 300 MT by 2030: Report
description: India aims to significantly increase steel production to 300 MT by 2030, heavily relying on coking coal. To reduce import dependence, the government is promoting domestic production through the Atmanirbhar Coal Mission and policy reforms. The steel industry is also focusing on decarbonization efforts to reduce its environmental impact and achieve net-zero emissions by 2070.

title: India's coking coal demand to surge to 135mt by 2030
description: India's coking coal demand is projected to reach 135 million tonnes by 2030, fueled by steel industry growth. Domestic production is expected to more than double to 140 million tonnes, driven by government initiatives. While Australia remains a primary supplier, India is exploring new sources like Mongolia and Mozambique to diversify imports.

title: Vedanta’s Rs 17,000 crore bid for Jaiprakash Associates flagged as credit negative
description: CreditSights views Vedanta's proposed acquisition of Jaiprakash Associates Ltd (JAL) for Rs 17,000 crore as credit negative due to limited strategic synergies and JAL's financial struggles. The acquisition exposes Vedanta to cyclical sectors like real estate and cement, posing execution risks. S&P Global Ratings also warns of potential business weakening and increased leverage due to JAL's loss-making operations.

title: Vedanta in process of acquiring land for 3 MTPA aluminium smelter in Odisha
description: Vedanta is actively acquiring land in Dhenkanal, Odisha, to establish a new 3 MTPA aluminium smelter, aiming to double its total capacity to 6 MTPA. This significant investment, expected to generate over two lakh jobs, is progressing well and anticipated to take three to four years to complete.

title: Gujarat: CAG points out flaws in implementation of central scheme for mining-affected areas
description: The CAG report reveals flaws in Gujarat's implementation of the PMKKKY scheme, intended for mining-affected areas. Deficiencies include selecting agencies without tenders, leading to undue benefits, and non-completion of projects despite significant expenditure. The report also highlights non-compliance with GDMF rules, delays in accounts, and instances of projects benefiting private entities rather than the public.

title: India explores rare-earth deal with Myanmar rebels after Chinese curbs
description: India is reportedly collaborating with the Kachin Independence Army (KIA) in Myanmar to secure rare-earth mineral samples, aiming to diversify its supply chain away from China. The Ministry of Mines has engaged state-owned and private firms to explore sourcing these strategic resources from KIA-controlled mines.

title: Shyam Metalics forays into crash barrier manufacturing
description: Shyam Metalics has announced its entry into the crash barrier manufacturing sector, commencing production at its Giridih facility with a 24,000 metric tonne annual capacity. The company aims to secure an 8-10% market share by FY26.

title: India revs up alternate EV motor tests as China curbs rare earths exports
description: India is accelerating efforts to cut reliance on China for rare earths by developing magnet-free EV motors. Faridabad-based Sterling Gtake E-Mobility is fast-tracking trials, with automakers reviewing designs for early production.

title: CIL mulls setting up data centres in decommissioned mines to boost digital infra, sustainability
description: Coal India Limited is exploring the feasibility of establishing data centers in its decommissioned mines, aiming to capitalize on existing infrastructure and contribute to India's growing digital capacity. The initiative aligns with the Digital India and Make in India missions, repurposing redundant mining assets for high-value infrastructure.

title: Domestic coal production drops marginally in April-August period to 381.75 MT
description: India's coal production experienced a slight dip of 0.6% to 381.75 million tonnes during April-August, compared to 384.037 MT last year. Coal India led with 280.15 MT. However, August witnessed a robust 11.5% surge, reaching 69.87 MT. Government initiatives, including policy measures and stakeholder support, fueled this growth.

title: Uni Abex Alloy to invest Rs 100 crore to double production capacity of high-performance alloys
description: Uni Abex Alloy Products Ltd will invest over Rs 100 crore to double its high-performance alloys production capacity by FY26. The expansion at its Dharwad facility in Karnataka aims to meet rising demand from industries like iron, steel, petrochemicals, and fertilizers. This strategic move will increase production from 6,000 to 12,000 metric tonnes per annum.

title: Jaiprakash Associates bid: Vedanta offers Rs 4,000 cr upfront payment, rest over 5-6 years
description: Vedanta Ltd has emerged as the highest bidder for debt-ridden Jaiprakash Associates Ltd (JAIL), offering a net present value of Rs 12,505 crore. The payment will be staggered, with Rs 4,000 crore paid post-NCLT approval and the balance over 5-6 years. This acquisition complements Vedanta's existing businesses and leverages JAL's assets in power, real estate, and mining.

title: Vedanta to pour Rs 17,000 cr into Jaiprakash Associates, beats Adani bid
description: Vedanta won the bid for Jaiprakash Associates with a ₹17,000-crore offer. It outbid Adani Enterprises in the insolvency battle. The deal involves major cement facilities. Only Vedanta and Adani submitted binding offers. Other suitors like Jindal Power and Dalmia Bharat did not participate. The Committee of Creditors will review Vedanta's winning bid. The resolution process for Jaiprakash Associates faced delays.

title: Vedanta beats Adani for acquisition of Jaiprakash Associates
description: Vedanta Group has emerged as the winning bidder for the debt-ridden Jaiprakash Associates (JAL), surpassing Gautam Adani's Group in a competitive acquisition process. The mining conglomerate's bid of Rs 17,000 crore translated to a net present value of Rs 12,505 crore. JAL, facing insolvency proceedings due to loan defaults, attracted multiple bidders, with Vedanta ultimately securing the deal.

title: System soon to spot hurdles in starting production at mines
description: The government is preparing a system to find problems in starting auctioned mineral blocks. A new online portal will monitor the progress of approvals for these blocks. This aims to speed up clearances. Only a few auctioned mines are currently working. Delays in environmental approvals are a major reason. The central government will work with states to accelerate approvals.

title: Aluminium extrusion industry body seeks review of import duties, FTAs to offset US tariff impact
description: ALEMAI urges the government to address import duties, FTAs, and policies to boost domestic aluminium consumption and counter US tariffs. India's aluminium extrusion industry faces underutilization due to imports, despite its 3 million tonnes capacity. Increased local consumption and production can enhance global competitiveness and offset tariff impacts, fostering growth in sectors like construction and renewable energy.

title: Cabinet approves Rs 1,500 crore sops for critical mineral recycling
description: The cabinet committee has approved a Rs 1,500 crore incentive for critical mineral recycling. This scheme spans six years, from FY26 to FY31. It targets e-waste, LIB scrap, and end-of-life vehicle scrap. The plan aims to recycle 10% of India's critical minerals. It anticipates Rs 8,000 crore in investment and 40 kilo ton of mineral production.

title: Cabinet clears Rs 1,500 crore scheme for critical mineral recycling
description: The Union Cabinet has approved a ₹1,500 crore scheme. It will boost recycling of critical minerals. The scheme aims to strengthen India’s domestic capacity. It will run from FY 2025-26 to FY 2030-31. The initiative will cover e-waste and lithium-ion battery recycling. Government expects to create annual recycling capacity. It will also generate employment.

title: Centre defers decision on Vedanta's proposal to divert 708 hectares of forest land for Sijimali Bauxite Mines
description: The Union Environment Ministry has delayed Vedanta's bauxite mining project in Odisha due to concerns over community consent and ecological impact. The Forest Advisory Committee cited issues with fraudulently obtained Gram Sabha resolutions and the project's location within elephant habitat. Odisha must address these concerns, including erosion control and compensatory afforestation, before the project can proceed.

title: Top Indian miner’s renewable plan looks at a future beyond coal
description: Coal India Ltd., the world's largest coal producer, is diversifying its portfolio by seeking bids for 5 gigawatts of renewable energy projects, including 3 GW of solar and 2 GW of wind. This move addresses concerns about declining coal demand due to growing renewable energy adoption and increased competition. The company aims to install 9.

title: HZL plans to produce up to 4 new metals by 2030: CEO
description: Hindustan Zinc plans to diversify its product portfolio by 2030, incorporating critical minerals like neodymium, tungsten, and potash. The company, already a dominant player in zinc, lead, and silver, aims to leverage its deep mining expertise to extract these difficult-to-mine resources.

title: India seeks WTO consultations with US over 50 pc duty on copper
description: India has initiated discussions with the United States regarding tariffs on copper. This action follows India's reservation of rights to impose retaliatory duties. The US imposed a 50 percent tariff on certain copper imports. India considers this a safeguard measure and seeks consultations under WTO rules. Trade negotiations between India and the US are currently paused.

title: Adani Power gets Coal Ministry clearance to start mining at MP's Dhirauli block
description: Adani Power gains coal ministry's nod for Dhirauli mine in Madhya Pradesh. Mahan Energen Ltd will manage the mine. It will fuel Adani's Mahan power plant, undergoing expansion. The mine boasts 620 MMT reserves and a 6.5 MTPA peak production capacity. This move strengthens Adani's raw material security. The company aims for responsible mining practices.

title: JSW Steel puts coking coal sourcing plans from Mongolia on hold amid logistics challenges
description: JSW Steel has paused its plan to import coking coal from Mongolia due to significant logistical challenges in transporting the material to India. The company found it not logistically feasible at the moment. India relies heavily on coking coal imports, primarily from Australia, and the government has been exploring alternative sources to diversify supply.

title: Coal India's production drops 4% in April-August
description: Coal India Ltd (CIL) reported a 3.5% decline in production, totaling 280.2 million tonnes, during April-August of the current fiscal year, despite government efforts to increase output and reduce import reliance. Several CIL subsidiaries experienced negative growth, although August's output reached 50.4 MT, surpassing the previous year's 46.1 MT. CIL aims for 875 million tonnes production in 2025-26.

title: Vedanta hands out ESOPs worth Rs 450 crore in FY2025
description: Vedanta Limited has granted Employee Stock Options Scheme worth Rupees 450 crore for fiscal year 2025. This ESOS allows employees to purchase company shares at a discounted rate. It includes both top management and entry-level professionals. The company has been administering its ESOS for over 20 years. Equity awards have increased significantly in the last five years.

title: Lloyds Metals and Energy commissions 360 KTPA sponge iron plant at Ghugus in Maharashtra
description: Lloyds Metals and Energy Limited commissioned its 360 KTPA sponge iron plant in Ghugus, Maharashtra, within 18 months of receiving environmental clearance. The plant, which has been executed by Lloyds Engineering Works, increases LMEL's total sponge iron capacity to 700 KTPA. The facility will support captive utilisation of mined iron ore and strengthen LMEL's integrated steel-making value chain.

title: India, Japan to collaborate on defence, critical minerals
description: India and Japan have forged a new pact to boost defence industrial collaboration, encompassing government and private sectors. They will jointly explore critical minerals, including refining, and increase cooperation between special forces. The nations aim to co-develop equipment and technology for future security needs, leveraging Japan's advanced maritime technologies.

title: A quiet revolution is unfolding in the mining sector
description: The mining industry is reinventing itself with AI, bio-tech, and waste re-mining to tackle falling ore grades and soaring demand for copper. From Hindustan Zinc to BHP, innovations promise cleaner, more efficient production, offering hope the world won’t run out of copper after all.

title: NALCO eyes commercial lithium mining in Argentina
description: NALCO, through joint venture KABIL, has acquired five mines in Argentina and completed non-invasive exploration. The company will now begin detailed invasive exploration to assess lithium deposits, which could take up to two years. CMD Brijendra Pratap Singh said prospects appear strong, given nearby Chinese mines. He added that US tariffs have no direct impact on NALCO.

title: NALCO to pump in ₹30,000 cr for expansion drive
description: National Aluminium Company Limited (NALCO) is set to invest ₹30,000 crore in the next five years to expand its capacity, focusing on smelting and power generation. The PSU plans to add 1 million tonnes of aluminium refining capacity by June next year in Angul, increasing its total capacity to 3.1 mt.

title: NALCO to invest $3.43 billion to build smelter, coal power plant
description: National Aluminium Company will invest a large sum. The investment will be around 300 billion rupees. This investment is for a new smelter and coal power plant. The project will span over the next five years. The smelter will be in Odisha. NALCO is in talks with Coal India and NTPC. The power plant project requires 120 billion rupees.

title: Govt cancels auction of 5 critical mineral blocks due to poor response
description: India's government has cancelled the auction of five critical mineral blocks, including a rare earth element (REE) block in Karnataka, due to a tepid response in the fifth round. The mines ministry cited a lack of bids for three blocks and insufficient technically qualified bidders for two others as reasons for the annulment.

title: JSW Steel, APMDC incorporate JV for iron ore project in Andhra Pradesh
description: JSW Steel has partnered with Andhra Pradesh Mineral Development Corporation Limited (APMDC) to establish APJSW Private Limited, a joint venture for an iron ore project in Andhra Pradesh. With an investment of ₹1,075 crore, the Konijedu Marlapadu Integrated Iron Ore Project aims to mine and beneficiate low-grade iron ore. JSW Steel holds 89% equity in the JV.

title: Viksit Bharat 2047: New mining law on cards
description: The Centre plans to replace the Mines and Minerals (Development and Regulation) Act, 1957, with new legislation to align with Viksit Bharat 2047 goals. An inter-ministerial committee, including representatives from various ministries and Niti Aayog, has been formed to draft the new law, incorporating future trends and consulting stakeholders.

title: HZL eyes rare earth elements, seeks global partners for AI, drone-led mineral exploration
description: Hindustan Zinc Ltd is venturing into rare earth elements, seeking global collaborations for AI and drone-based exploration of critical minerals. The company successfully bid for rare earth (monazite) blocks in the government's auction, aiming to strengthen India's mineral security. This move transforms HZL into a multi-metal enterprise, reducing reliance on China-dominated rare earth production.

title: Fortune in the fields: Diamond rush sweeps Andhra villages this monsoon
description: Early rains in Rayalaseema region of Andhra Pradesh have sparked a diamond rush. Farmers and villagers in Kurnool and Anantapur districts are searching for precious stones. Many hope to change their fortunes by finding diamonds in rain-washed lands. Some have sold stones for significant sums. The activity is a seasonal tradition, driven by hope and folklore. Concerns about exploitation persist.

title: China's rare earth curbs gone, but the trap remains
description: China's recent lifting of export curbs to India offers temporary relief but highlights India's vulnerability due to its dependence on Chinese critical materials. China strategically uses exports as leverage, creating uncertainty and hindering self-reliance. India is now urged to accelerate domestic capacity building, diversify supply chains, and foster international partnerships to counter China's dominance and ensure long-term economic resilience.

title: China releases interim measures for regulating rare earths industry
description: China has issued interim rules to regulate rare earths mining, smelting, and separation, aiming to protect its domestic industry. As the world’s top supplier of these critical minerals used in EVs, wind turbines, and defense, China launched a public consultation in February to draft stricter controls. The new measures seek to strengthen oversight and resource security.

title: Working hard to increase coal gasification: Coal & mines minister G Kishan Reddy
description: The government is actively promoting coal gasification to diversify mining practices and encourage cleaner coal utilization. An action plan is underway, involving state governments and stakeholders, to tap into deep-seated coal reserves unsuitable for conventional mining. Reforms, including open auctions, have increased transparency and coal production, significantly reducing coal shortages and imports.

title: Hindalco doubling down on upstream capacities with substantial investments in aluminium, copper smelting
description: Hindalco is significantly boosting its upstream capabilities with major investments in aluminium and copper smelting across India. Expansions include increasing capacity at the Aditya and Mahan aluminium smelters, alongside building a new alumina refinery. The company is also enhancing its downstream portfolio with value-added products and a focus on recycling, aiming to quadruple downstream EBITDA by FY30.

title: NITI Aayog calls stakeholder consultation to arrive at best gasification technology for Indian coal
description: NITI Aayog has raised concerns about the suitability of current gasification technologies for India's high-ash coal, hindering progress towards the government's 100-mt coal gasification target by 2030. The think tank plans discussions with stakeholders to identify appropriate technologies and business models. The goal is to achieve energy security and reduce import dependence through coal gasification.

title: Vedanta demerger deadline at risk as NCLT defers hearing
description: Vedanta's proposed demerger faces a delay as the National Company Law Tribunal defers the hearing to September 17 after objections from the Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas. The ministry raised concerns about the potential impact on recovering dues from Vedanta's oil and gas operations.

title: Govt to launch 13th round of commercial coal mines auction on Thursday
description: The government is scheduled to launch the 13th round of commercial coal mine auctions on August 21, 2025, in New Delhi, aiming to boost coal production and meet the country's increasing energy demands. This round will offer mines with liberal terms to attract diverse investments and promote ease of doing business.

title: NCLT defers Vedanta demerger hearing to September 17 following objections from SEBI, Centre
description: The National Company Law Tribunal has postponed Vedanta Limited's demerger hearing. The new date is September 17. This decision follows objections from SEBI and the Central government. The Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas had earlier raised concerns. SEBI is verifying Vedanta's compliance. The NSE has issued a no-objection certificate. Vedanta announced its demerger plan in September 2023.

title: Vedanta's ambitious demerger plan faces rocky road ahead as government raises objection
description: Vedanta's demerger plan faces a big hurdle as the Central government raises serious objections, citing concerns about potential concealment of information, inflated revenues, and undisclosed liabilities. This objection follows a warning from the markets regulator regarding non-compliance issues. The NCLT has postponed the hearing on the demerger case to September 17.

title: China’s rare earth export curbs strain India’s supply chains; Bilateral deals signed to secure critical minerals
description: China's export restrictions on rare earth magnets have created supply chain challenges for Indian industries, particularly electric vehicle manufacturers, as stated by the government in the Lok Sabha. The mines ministry is actively engaging with stakeholders and pursuing bilateral agreements with countries like Australia and Argentina to ensure a resilient supply chain for critical minerals.

title: US tariff will have no impact on NALCO, company eyeing UK market: CMD
description: National Aluminium Company Limited (NALCO) reports a significant profit surge. The company is shifting its focus to the United Kingdom due to zero duty benefits. NALCO plans to start operations at its Pottangi bauxite mines in Odisha by next June. Expansion plans are underway to meet India's growing aluminium demand.

title: Parliament passes mining law amendments
description: Parliament has approved changes to the mining laws. Union Minister G Kishan Reddy highlighted increased state revenue from mining. He noted significant forex savings due to higher domestic coal production. Iron ore production has almost doubled since 2014. The amendments aim to boost critical mineral exploration. They also allow for overseas asset acquisition and a mineral exchange.

title: Parliament passes Mines and Minerals Amendment Bill
description: Parliament has approved the Mines and Minerals Amendment Bill, 2025, to modernize India's mineral sector, particularly focusing on critical and strategic minerals. The bill renames and expands the National Mineral Exploration Trust to include development, both domestically and internationally. This reform aims to secure India's economic future by addressing outdated laws and promoting sustainable development in mining areas.

title: Hindustan Zinc to expand into uranium mining if government allows, CEO says
description: Hindustan Zinc aims to venture into uranium mining if India opens the sector to private firms, aligning with the government's nuclear expansion plans. The company also plans to mine rare earth minerals, starting with a block in Uttar Pradesh, and seeks partnerships for exploring lithium, antimony, and other critical minerals.

title: India's iron-ore, coking coal, Potash demand to rise on robust economic growth: BHP
description: BHP's outlook forecasts a significant rise in demand for iron ore, coking coal, and potash in India, driven by infrastructure investment and manufacturing expansion. India's steel demand is projected to quadruple in 25 years, positioning the nation as a key opportunistic iron ore importer. Calibrated stimulus in China and continued strength in India are expected to support mineral markets.

title: Faster approvals for critical minerals, but no green law exemption: Centre
description: The Environment Ministry has created a new category on its online portal. This will expedite clearances for mining projects involving critical minerals. The goal is to boost domestic supply. These minerals are essential for clean energy and advanced technologies. The Mines Ministry requested faster clearances in February. 34 blocks of these minerals have been auctioned across India.

title: Hindustan Zinc to set up 10 MTA tailings reprocessing plant at Rs 3,823 cr
description: Hindustan Zinc, a Vedanta subsidiary, is investing Rs 3,823 crore in a 10 MTPA Tailings Reprocessing plant, a first in India, to recover metal from tailings and reduce its environmental impact. This initiative is part of a larger plan to double production capacity, targeting annual revenue of Rs 62,000-65,000 crore and increasing silver production to 1,500 tonnes.

title: CIL pushes ahead with evacuation amid Q1FY26 slowdown in coal demand
description: Coal India Ltd is proceeding with infrastructure development plans despite a sluggish first quarter, allocating ₹5,622 crore for coal transportation and evacuation. The company aims to increase mechanised coal evacuation capacity significantly by FY29 and remains committed to achieving 1 billion tonnes of production. CIL is also expanding its renewable energy portfolio, targeting 3 GW of solar capacity by FY28.

title: Papum Pare to Singrauli: India maps fresh hotspots for rare earth metals amid China concerns
description: India is actively exploring inland rare earth element (REE) deposits in regions like Arunachal Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh, aiming to reduce reliance on China. While new discoveries offer hope, diversifying supply chains and boosting domestic production are crucial. The government is incentivizing local mining and pursuing international collaborations to secure critical mineral access and foster innovation.

title: Hindustan Zinc gears up for mega expansion; Eyes ₹65k cr revenue
description: Hindustan Zinc Ltd. (HZL) aims for ₹62,000-65,000 crore in annual revenue by doubling its production capacity to 2 million tonnes. The Vedanta subsidiary anticipates an EBITDA of ₹34,000-36,000 crore and a production cost of $1,000 per tonne at this expanded capacity. Silver production is also expected to rise to 1,500 tonnes.

title: Indian miner IREL seeks Japan, South Korea partnerships for rare earth magnet production
description: India's IREL aims to collaborate with Japan and South Korea for rare earth magnet production. This initiative seeks to decrease dependence on China. IREL is in talks with Toyotsu Rare Earths India. The company explores mining opportunities in Argentina, Australia, Malawi, and Myanmar. IREL plans to seek board approval for commercial magnet production this year.

title: Adani's new copper smelter in India applies to become LME-listed brand
description: Adani Enterprises' new copper smelter in India, boasting a 500,000-ton annual capacity, has applied for LME listing amidst shrinking smelting margins. The $1.2 billion Kutch Copper facility, expected to begin smelting in May, aims to reduce India's reliance on copper imports. Codelco will supply copper concentrates to the smelter.

title: India set to allow its private firms to mine and import uranium to help nuclear expansion
description: India is set to end its state monopoly over the nuclear sector, allowing private firms to mine, import, and process uranium. This move aims to attract billions in investment and boost nuclear power production twelvefold by 2047. The government will retain control over spent fuel reprocessing and waste management while relaxing foreign investment rules to meet rising fuel demands.

title: Hindalco's 30% net jump in June quarter puts Novelis revival in strong focus
description: Hindalco Industries, which reported consolidated earnings on Tuesday, posted a 30% rise in consolidated net profit for the June quarter at ₹4,004 crore, with consolidated revenue from operations up 13% at ₹64,232 crore.

title: Lok Sabha passes Mines and Minerals Amendment Bill
description: Amidst opposition protests regarding the revision of Bihar electoral rolls, the Lok Sabha approved the Mines and Minerals (Development and Regulation) Amendment Bill 2025. The bill expands the National Mineral Exploration Trust's scope to include offshore and international areas for mineral exploration and development. It also renames the trust and increases lessee payments to 3% of the royalty.

title: Hindustan Zinc becomes first Indian firm to join International Council on Mining and Metals
description: Hindustan Zinc Limited (HZL) has achieved a significant milestone by becoming the first Indian company to join the International Council on Mining and Metals (ICMM). This membership underscores HZL's commitment to sustainable development and responsible mining practices. The induction follows a thorough assessment and endorsement by ICMM, positioning India prominently in the global mining landscape.
